title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as education and support to their immediate family members. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide education, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans and their immediate family members for readjustment to civilian life and recovery from deployment-related injuries or illnesses. This includes contracts with community mental health centers and qualified entities for service provision. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services for veterans and their families, focusing on recovery from deployment-related injuries or illnesses and readjustment to civilian life. The contracts will require the use of telehealth services and the employment of trained veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs will contract with community health centers to provide services for veterans, requiring the use of telehealth services, employing trained veterans, participating in training programs, and complying with VA protocols. Annual reports must be submitted to the Secretary. The Department of Veterans Affairs contracts with community health centers to provide services for veterans, including telehealth services and trained veteran staff. Annual reports must be submitted to the Secretary, detailing the number of veterans served, diagnoses, treatments, and demographic information. Clinical summary information for each veteran receiving mental health services must also be provided to the VA. The Secretary requires community mental health centers to provide clinical summary information for veterans receiving mental health services. Additionally, a national not-for-profit mental health organization will train veterans to provide peer-outreach and peer-support services as part of the program. Clinicians will also receive training to provide services. The Secretary will contract with a national mental health organization to train veterans to provide services. Clinicians at community mental health centers will also receive training to provide services tailored to veterans' unique experiences. Reports will be required. The Secretary will implement a program for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom, using best practices and technologies. Reports on the implementation plan and status will be submitted to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs. The Secretary will submit a report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs on the implementation of the program for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. The report will include information on the number of veterans receiving services and an evaluation of the provision of services. The report will evaluate the provision of services for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom, including recommendations for extending service periods and assessing training programs.
